details.text: Platform interface logic.
Global interconnect for 7 global loads and 1 global store. Reduce number of global loads and stores to simplify global interconnect.
See %L for more information

links.guide: Best Practices Guide : Global Memory Interconnect

details.text: This read-only memory contains information for the host about the system and about each kernel in the system, including kernel names, arguments, and attributes.  The system description ROM ensures that the binary image on the FPGA is compatible with the host program.
Number of compute units: 1
Max global work dimension: 0
Type: Register
1 register of width 32 and depth 1
Type: Register
1 register of width 32 and depth 302 (depth was increased by a factor of 299 due to a loop initiation interval of 299.)
Resources for loop-carried dependencies. To reduce this area:
reduce number and size of loop-carried variables
Resources for live values and control logic. To reduce this area:
reduce size of local variables
reduce scope of local variables, localizing them as much as possible
reduce number of nested loops
Logic required to efficiently support sets of operations that do not stall. This area cannot be affected directly.
Load uses a Prefetching LSU
Load uses a Prefetching LSU
Load uses a Prefetching LSU
Load uses a Prefetching LSU
Load uses a Prefetching LSU

Load uses a Burst-coalesced cached LSU.  Load with a private 512 kilobit cache. Cache is not shared with any other load. It is flushed on kernel start. Use Dynamic Profiler to verify cache effectiveness. Other kernels should not be updating the data in global memory while this kernel is using it. Cache is created when memory access pattern is data-dependent or appears to be repetitive. Simplify access pattern or mark pointer as 'volatile' to disable generation of this cache.
